Key Match Events: Jake Bauers hit a game-ending single in the ninth inning to lift the Milwaukee Brewers to a 2-1 win over the Philadelphia Phillies
Pre-Game Insights: The Brewers had already clinched the NL Central division title earlier in the day, but still needed to win the game to prevent the Phillies from securing a playoff berth
Post-Match Reflections: Jake Bauers said the vibe in the clubhouse was that they needed to win the game despite already clinching the division title
Devin Williams struck out three batters in a row in the ninth inning to secure the win
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies' magic number to qualify for the playoffs is one, and four to clinch the NL East
The Phillies made the playoffs the past two seasons, losing to Arizona in the 2023 NL Championship Series and to Houston in the 2022 World Series
Others: The teams struck out 28 times combined
Phillies batters struck out 16 times Tuesday and 16 times Wednesday
